item.title: Gout Gout makes his senior debut at the World Athletics Championships
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gout Gout finishes third in 200m heat
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Northern WA communities already adapting to extreme climate future
item.description: Locals in small northern WA communities say the potential dangers identified by the Climate Risk Assessment are already starting to appear.

item.title: Gaming history goes on display with Australian titles Hollow Knight Silksong and Team Fortress chronicled
item.description: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

item.title: How youth orchestras foster lifelong friendships and open career pathways for musicians
item.description: With youth orchestras set to busk on the streets of Sydney and Melbourne this weekend, Australian musicians share how those orchestras helped shape their careers.

item.title: Cairns maternity ward named as exposure site in Far North Queensland measles outbreak
item.description: More locally acquired cases have been confirmed with exposure sites now including Cairns Hospital's maternity ward and areas on the Atherton Tablelands.

item.title: Gardeners share the joys of turning dust to daisies in the Australian outback
item.description: Flower farmer Suzanne Stanton says generations of outback women have taken comfort in their gardens, proof that life can survive in the harshest of climates.

item.title: Palliative Care Australia art prize inspires conversations about death and grieving
item.description: In its fifth year, Palliative Care Australia's Live Well, Die Well national art prize continues to spark important conversations about dying.

item.title: Authorities urge parents to check Little Ones Nappy Pants for khapra beetle larvae
item.description: Hundreds of cartons of nappy pants remain unaccounted for after one of the biggest threats to Australia's grain industry, khapra beetle larvae, was found in the imported products.

item.title: Qantas to review staff bases in Mildura, Canberra and Hobart
item.description: There are concerns the decision could impact regional flights, as staff would have to travel from Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane to get to work.

item.title: Family of Aboriginal man killed in Darwin hit-and-run speak out over driver's sentence
item.description: The family of an Aboriginal man killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out about the sentence handed to the man who killed him, and the "racist, dehumanising" messages he sent afterwards.

item.title: Albanese to meet with Trump after returning from Pacific empty-handed
item.description: This week in politics, the prime minister returned home from the Pacific empty-handed and the climate debate continued to unsettle the Coalition.

item.title: Albury Wodonga Regional Cancer Centre to become public hospital
item.description: A major cancer centre on the Victorian-New South Wales border will become a fully public hospital in a move that has caught a healthcare provider by surprise and sparked community concern.

item.title: WA coal phase-out uncertainty amid Bluewaters power station closure backflip
item.description: Efforts by WA's government to force the premature closure of a privately owned coal plant appear to be unravelling after the market operator backed the power station to keep running towards the end of the decade.

item.title: Henley residents advised to keep windows, doors closed amid algal bloom crisis
item.description: Authorities have told a group of residents living near a metropolitan Adelaide beach to close their doors and windows to prevent symptoms related to South Australia's ongoing algal bloom.

item.title: Surprise La Niña hints at another wet and stormy Australian summer
item.description: Australia's key drivers of weather variability are stacking up to produce another wet, severe-weather season, with an increased risk of flooding, thunderstorms and cyclones.

item.title: Fire at the Jam Factory complex in South Yarra damages Melbourne construction site
item.description: Callers to triple-0 report thick smoke billowing from the historical complex in Melbourne's inner south-east.

item.title: Actress Joan Marion never returned to Tasmania, but 'her heart was always in Launceston'
item.description: Tasmania's Joan Marion became a star of the screen and stage abroad; her granddaughter says she maintained a connection to Launceston for much of her life.

item.title: Warm currents bring tens of thousands of giant yellowfin tuna to NSW South Coast
item.description: Fishers are reporting an unprecedented number of yellowfin tuna travelling from the tropics to the NSW South Coast, causing "mayhem" and excitement.

item.title: Wiluna leaders hoping 'bounty' will reduce stray dog numbers in town
item.description: Wiluna, in Western Australia's far northern Goldfields, is looking to revive a cash incentive for community members to surrender domestic dogs for rehoming.

item.title: Asbestos discovery further delays Willyama High School demolition
item.description: Nearly two years after a mould-infested high school was closed indefinitely, high-risk friable asbestos has caused further delays to its demolition.

item.title: RONA. weaves together country, colonialism and club music on new EP It's All Here
item.description: This Kaytetye producer has a fresh take on the space race that draws from First Nations knowledge and culture.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann likely to face four-day hearing in Tasmania over motor vehicle stealing charge
item.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in the Hobart Magistrates Court after pleading not guilty to one count of motor vehicle stealing.

item.title: Russell Vale Mine Shaft 4 to trial Green Gravity renewable energy technology
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Green Gravity secures old coal mine shaft to test gravitational energy storage
item.description: A disused coal mine in Wollongong will be the first test site for a renewable energy company that lowers weights down old mine shafts to spin turbines and create electricity.

item.title: Pat Cummins hints at Ashes strategy amid recovery from back injury with 'starting aim' of playing in all five Tests
item.description: As the men's Ashes approaches, the Australian captain reveals his hopes for taking part in the five-Test series against England as he steps up his injury recovery.

item.title: Report scathing of police and CCC over failure to respond to complaints of police misconduct
item.description: WA Police and the CCC are put on notice after failing to adequately respond to complaints of serious police misconduct, including an allegation an off-duty officer choked a man following a road rage incident.

item.title: What we know about the Optus outage which disrupted triple-zero calls, linked to three deaths
item.description: It's been two days since three people died after a devastating Optus outage caused hundreds of emergency calls to fail, but information about the incident remains scarce.

item.title: Investigation of eye-maker's online presence reveals multiple red flags
item.description: A reverse-image search of ocularist Jack McDonald's website shows that receptionist "Nadia" also appears on a dentistry blog and is known as "Donna" on a self-help guru's site. It's just one of the red flags that ABC NEWS Verify spotted during its investigation.

item.title: NSW RFS provides tips on preparing your home for bushfires
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Remote NSW council holds election after 12 years in administration
item.description: The 700 voters living in the remote Central Darling Shire Council area of New South Wales will finally head to the polls to vote again.

item.title: More than 800 Indonesian students get food poisoning from free school meals
item.description: Over 800 students fall sick in two cases of mass food poisoning in one week after consuming free school meals sponsored by the Indonesian government.

item.title: 'America is not happy': ABC under fire for pulling Jimmy Kimmel Live!
item.description: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

item.title: Canada beats New Zealand 34-19 to reach Women's Rugby World Cup final
item.description: A changing of the guard in women's rugby union as two-time defending world champions New Zealand is beaten for the first time at the tournament since 2014 by a brilliant Canadian side.

item.title: Near-blinded police officer reunites with those who saved him after rural motorcycle crash
item.description: Police officer John Kenworthy returns to thank the first responders in Mackay, and others who were with him in his darkest moments, after a rural motorcycle crash.

item.title: Critical incident declared after man dies during alleged DV arrest in Sydney's south west
item.description: Police were called to two separate domestic-related incidents in New South Wales overnight.

item.title: Kamala Harris's frustration with Joe Biden, and other takeaways from her election trail memoir
item.description: Kamala Harris has kept a low profile since losing the US election, but she has plenty to say in her upcoming book — a diary from her doomed campaign.

item.title: Yolŋu people celebrate 50 years of the homelands movement in East Arnhem Land
item.description: Yolŋu children from nine Laynhapuy communities are screaming the Yothu Yindi anthem, Homeland Movement, in a ceremony celebrating the Indigenous elders who claimed back life on their country 50 years ago.

item.title: Super Netball celebrates bumper year as Sunshine Coast Lightning drives registration surge
item.description: A Queensland community is reaping the rewards of establishing the first regional professional netball team in the national league.

item.title: Crowds flock to Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers despite wet weather
item.description: Cold and damp conditions have not been enough to keep people away from Toowoomba's annual floral extravaganza.

item.title: Queensland's measles outbreak growing after case confirmed in rural town Middlemount
item.description: A rural town in central Queensland is the latest community affected, after a case was recorded in Middlemount.

item.title: Former nurse shares devastating experience of attempts to get urgent cancer surgery
item.description: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

item.title: Street artist Rone's new 90-metre mural a visual love letter to Geelong
item.description: The faces of 14 people will be immortalised in an enormous mural on the side of a new building in Geelong by locally born, globally renowned artist Rone.

item.title: Republicans warn Anthony Albanese of 'punitive measures' over Palestinian recognition
item.description: As Anthony Albanese touches down in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly, Republicans issue a warning against formally recognising Palestinian statehood.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: Life on Aboriginal reserve remembered by Carnarvon traditional owners
item.description: In 1975, an anthropologist wrote his thesis on Carnarvon's rich Aboriginal reserve. Decades later, traditional owners revisit the work to contribute to "big truth-telling" documentary.

item.title: Australian-born singer drops out of Russian-hosted Intervision song contest after 'political pressure'
item.description: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

item.title: Penola High School's agriculture program revives community and enrolments
item.description: Cory O'Connor's three-week teaching placement turned around his hometown high school. Now he's receiving an award for the agriculture program he started there.

item.title: Cats star Tyson Stengle desperate to win second AFL premiership
item.description: Three years after Tyson Stengle capped off his remarkable AFL career resurrection with a premiership, the Geelong forward believes a second premiership would hold greater significance.

item.title: Penrith Panthers hammer Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs to keep NRL premiership five-peat hopes alive
item.description: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

item.title: How to clean out your wardrobe as the seasons change
item.description: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

item.title: Dayne Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Mason Cox's glasses in Lions' win over Magpies
item.description: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Gene editing is being sold on the promise of healthier babies — but what are the ethical concerns?
item.description: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it is still deeply controversial.

item.title: The government says its 2035 climate targets are achievable but mathematics suggests a different story
item.description: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

item.title: Dementia-linked protein lower in people reporting vigorous exercise, study finds
item.description: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

item.title: Australia has been free of endemic measles since 2014. Could that change?
item.description: So far this year, there have been 121 measles notifications across Australia — the highest number since 2019, when there were 284 notifications.

item.title: Murray River flood may not be to blame for SA algal bloom, Senate inquiry hears
item.description: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

item.title: Short-term stays are swallowing up housing stock in these WA coastal havens
item.description: With one of the nation's highest proportions of Airbnbs, some of WA's most popular tourist towns face a dilemma. Tourism is their biggest breadwinner — but with a housing crisis in full swing, short-term stays are pushing more and more locals away.

item.title: Sam Kerr earns a standing ovation in home game return as Chelsea defeats Leicester 1-0 in WSL
item.description: Chelsea fans stand and applaud Australian superstar Sam Kerr in her long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow in the WSL.

item.title: World leaders are meeting at the UN General Assembly this week. Here are four things to watch for
item.description: World leaders are arriving in New York for the UN General Assembly — and for the first time, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among them.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage investigation underway as minister warns of 'consequences'
item.description: The Australian Media and Communications Authority begins its investigation into the Optus triple-0 outage that has been linked to multiple deaths in South Australia and Western Australia.

item.title: Queensland CHO on state's measles outbreak
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Easy and healthy dinner recipes for spring
item.description: If you're looking for light dinner ideas as the weather warms up, we have plenty of easy options. Think veggie-filled frittatas and beef taco bowls with a few healthy swaps.

item.title: Is AI impacting your career or life plans? Has its rapid rise got you rethinking your future? The ABC wants to hear from you
item.description: Whether you’re a student halfway through a degree or a mid-career manager planning the next five years, artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping lives across the country. If you've been feeling its effects, the ABC wants to hear from you.

item.title: Super Netball's Sunshine Coast Lightning enters new Global Sports Fund Management Group ownership
item.description: Almost a decade after being co-founded by the Melbourne Storm and University of the Sunshine Coast, Super Netball's Lightning is entering a new era.

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025: All the best fashion looks from AFL's night of nights
item.description: Just after the fashion from this evening's Brownlow Medal? We've got you.

item.title: Matt Rowell wins 2025 Brownlow Medal as Gold Coast star beats out Nick Daicos and Bailey Smith
item.description: Matt Rowell becomes the second Gold Coast player to win the prestigious AFL award, as a questionable voting call regarding Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera leaves the room stunned.

item.title: Leopard sharks recorded mating by researcher in rare event off New Caledonia
item.description: A Sunshine Coast marine biologist has captured unique footage of two male sharks mating with a female in waters off New Caledonia.

item.title: More than $4 million in drugs seized across WA's far north in ongoing operation
item.description: Police in the Kimberley say an ongoing investigation has seized millions of dollars' worth of ammunition, methylamphetamine and other drugs.

item.title: Ley writes to Republicans vowing to revoke Palestine recognition ahead of Albanese's UN address
item.description: In an unorthodox move, Opposition Leader Sussan Ley writes to a group of Republicans reassuring the Coalition would withdraw recognition of Palestine, ahead of a major United Nations address to be delivered by the prime minister.

item.title: Moldovan authorities arrest 74 people over alleged Russia-backed election plot
item.description: The widespread raids came ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on Sunday, expected to determine whether the country will pursue closer ties with the European Union.

item.title: Three Australians lay dead as investors of Optus's parent company Singtel were buying up its shares
item.description: The actions by Optus management in the hours following a series of failed attempts by its customers to call triple-0 raises questions about the telco's fitness to operate in Australia.

item.title: The public hospital patients who ended up paying abortion clinics for miscarriage care
item.description: Brisbane women have told the ABC they paid an abortion clinic for their chosen miscarriage care rather than getting it at their large public hospital.

item.title: Sustainable Timber Tasmania mistake 'compromised' arrests of logging protesters
item.description: New documents show some of the reasons why charges against a number of forest protesters were dropped in Tasmania, with police now assisting the company to stop it from happening in future.

item.title: Turtle strandings and soft-shell syndrome cases fall as seagrass beds recover
item.description: Soft-shell syndrome had been devastating green sea turtle numbers since flood events began impacting their seagrass food source in 2022.

item.title: Doctors concerned easily accessible illegal cigarettes are causing smoking rates to increase
item.description: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

item.title: Byron Bay's 60-day holiday rental cap yields mixed results in first year
item.description: A year after controversial holiday rental caps were introduced in Byron Bay to boost rental availability, the data is unclear about whether the endeavour has been a success.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel reinstated after hundreds of stars back free speech
item.description: US comedian Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show will be reinstated after being taken off air, following remarks he made referencing right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Dash camera mandate for WA driving instructors considered as part of regulation review
item.description: The WA government is considering mandating the use of dash cameras for driving instructors, in a bid to better protect vulnerable student drivers.

item.title: Experts say paracetamol safe for pregnancy, no proof for autism link made by Donald Trump
item.description: Australia's medicines regulator says paracetamol remains safe to use during pregnancy despite Donald Trump's administration linking its use to an increased risk of autism.

item.title: Bushfire survivors still camping years later amid construction backlog
item.description: Five years after devastating bushfires swept through Mallacoota, some survivors are still making do with tents and camp kitchens amid a backlog of construction jobs.

item.title: Dave Barham steps down as Essendon president as Zach Merrett apologises to fans over Hawthorn meeting
item.description: Essendon president Dave Barham hands over his role to his understudy, continuing an off-season filled with change at the club as Zach Merrett speaks publicly for the first time on his flirtation with Hawthorn.

item.title: Darwin dancer with dislocated knee left waiting for ambulance for six hours
item.description: A 20-year-old dancer was left waiting for an ambulance for more than six hours after dislocating her knee during a competition in the Darwin CBD.

item.title: Paddleboarder gets too close to whales to film them, gets nudged away
item.description: Drone footage shows a paddleboarder getting too close to film a southern right whale mother and calf, and being nudged away by the whale, off Point Ann.

item.title: Devonport City Council approves memorial for victims of Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy
item.description: A proposed memorial at Coles Beach for the child victims of the Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy has been unanimously approved by the Devonport City Council.

item.title: Women band together to create community for rural mums feeling lonely
item.description: After raising biological and foster children on a farm 60 kilometres from the nearest major town, Tracey Angwin says being part of a community is essential for rural mums.

item.title: Chronic pain sufferer donates knitted goods for babies in intensive care
item.description: Knitting has become an outlet for Port Stephens woman Kim Franks, who is mostly housebound after a diagnosis of debilitating psoriasis.

item.title: Deeming rates have increased after a five-year freeze. Here's how that could impact pension payments
item.description: The changes impact people on Centrelink payments who earn an income from financial assets, but pensioners are the biggest group to be affected.

item.title: As a doctor I'm choosing self-care over resilience
item.description: As a doctor who advocates for self-care, it took me a surprisingly long time to look after myself. Now I'm trying to be a good example for my patients and other doctors.

item.title: NSW Police officer charged with assault over protest arrest of former Greens candidate Hannah Thomas
item.description: Hannah Thomas was among a group of pro-Palestinian protesters who demonstrated outside a manufacturing facility in June when she sustained a serious eye injury during her arrest for failing to comply with a move on direction.

item.title: Experts say it is safe to use paracetamol during pregnancy and Trump's autism declaration is 'baseless'
item.description: Donald Trump's advice that pregnant women should limit the use of paracetamol in pregnancy has been criticised as "baseless". So what does it mean for you?

item.title: ICC prosecutors charge Phillipines' former leader Duterte with crimes against humanity
item.description: Former president of the Philippines, Rodrigo Duterte, is accused of being involved in the murder of dozens of people.

item.title: Bill Gates pledges $US912 million to AIDS and malaria non-profit as US cuts funding
item.description: The tech entrepreneur's announcement follows deep cuts from governments around the world, led by the United States.

item.title: Brisbane Lions star Lachie Neale trains strongly and looks on track for a grand final spot
item.description: The 31-year-old dual Brownlow medallist, who has been battling a calf injury, took part in training drills in front of 2,000 Brisbane fans at the team's Springfield home.

item.title: Man known as 'Moore Park Rapist' pleads guilty to series of sexual assaults in Sydney
item.description: Glenn Cameron has remained in custody since he was arrested in February last year and charged with more than 30 offences in relation to eight victims.

item.title: MS support agency MS Society SA & NT outlines three-year losses, $2.5m debt
item.description: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, says it has debts of about $2.5 million and has been facing losses for three years.

item.title: Northern Territory CLP government is reviewing sentencing laws. But will it change anything?
item.description: The case of hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has brought renewed focus to the NT's legal system and the problems it faces. But will changing sentencing laws help?

item.title: Kevin Bacon on the importance of music, philanthropy and acting
item.description: He's a prolific fixture on our screens who's famously six degrees from almost anyone. But Kevin Bacon is also a passionate musician and philanthropist.

item.title: Concerns 'off-brand' cigarettes easy to access and cheaper
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage tragedy: What we know and how events unfolded
item.description: The first sign something was wrong came late on Friday afternoon. Now we have a clearer picture of how the triple-0 outage unfolded.

item.title: Sale of Australia's biggest sheep station at Rawlinna finally gets WA government approval
item.description: The WA government has finally signed off on the sale of Australia's largest sheep station almost seven months after UK-based Consolidated Pastoral Company announced plans to buy Rawlinna Station.

item.title: Thousands of bees swarm Wagga Wagga CBD
item.description: Thousands of bees appear without warning in the regional city, alarming locals and causing a commotion.

item.title: Two teenagers sentenced to detention over attacks on Perth men lured via Grindr app
item.description: Two "lawless" and "cruel" teenage boys who used social media to lure gay men to isolated locations in Perth before attacking them will remain in detention.

item.title: Record number of calls to poisons hotlines for children ingesting melatonin
item.description: The ABC has analysed data from poisons hotlines across the country, revealing almost 1,500 calls were made about children taking melatonin last year, a dramatic rise on previous figures.

item.title: Canola crop invaders seeking social media selfies told to stay off farms
item.description: Selfie hunters seeking the perfect social media photo among flowering canola are putting their safety and growers' livelihoods at risk, farmers say.

item.title: Dickie Bird, former English cricket umpire, dies aged 92
item.description: One of international cricket's most recognised umpires is being remembered for his "fairness, humour and love of the game".

item.title: NT government open to subdividing purpose-built State Square Art Gallery in Darwin
item.description: A leading figure in Australia's art world has criticised the Northern Territory government for considering splitting up the lease for a building designed as a major new art gallery, describing the plan as "pure madness".

item.title: Video record of violence and racism at Purnim Bears, Noorat country football grand final
item.description: The Purnim Bears were supposed to be the feel-good story of country football — a team uniting black and white communities. But their 1987 grand final was so violent it ended with their expulsion.

item.title: Offshore wind pioneer Henrik Stiesdal says Australia can learn from Europe
item.description: A Danish clean energy pioneer says Australia is poised for success with offshore wind, but there are lessons it can learn from abroad.

item.title: Unexplained lights in the sky sparks UAP chatter across much of Western Australia
item.description: Perth Observatory says it has received reports of lights dancing in the sky across a significant part of WA's Midwest and Goldfields, with an explanation yet to be found.

item.title: Queensland speed skydiver Natisha Dingle shows off her impressive skills.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Albanese's meeting with Trump matters for AUKUS and the role of the US in the Asia-Pacific
item.description: Trump clearly disagrees with Albanese on Palestine and the reality of climate change, but it's not on the scale of the beef he has with other countries.

item.title: Artemis program on track to take astronauts around the Moon: NASA
item.description: NASA's first crewed flight in its Artemis program — a trip around the Moon and back — is on track for launch in April 2026 and could potentially be moved up to February, the space agency says.

item.title: Trump claims paracetamol link to autism. Five experts explain what's wrong with that statement
item.description: Some leading Australian experts in medicine, autism research and obstetrics say the US president's claims are "a misreading of science," or at worst, "a misuse". Here's why.

item.title: Why the legacy of the 2023 NRL grand final hangs over the Broncos and Panthers
item.description: On Sunday, the Broncos and Panthers will face off in the finals for the first time since the 2023 grand final, but the memory of that night still hangs over both sides.

item.title: ABC ordered to pay $150,000 fine for unlawfully sacking journalist and presenter Antoinette Lattouf
item.description: The judge ordered ABC to pay a fine of $150,000 for unlawfully sacking journalist and presenter Antoinette Lattouf for reasons including her political opinions.

item.title: Wallabies fullback Andrew Kellaway ruled out of first Bledisloe Cup Test match against All Blacks
item.description: Wallabies fullback Andrew Kellaway will miss Saturday's Bledisloe Cup Test match against the All Blacks in Auckland, ruled out with a calf strain.

item.title: Canberra golf course redevelopments providing both much-needed housing and financial lifelines for struggling clubs
item.description: With the ACT government pushing for greater urban density, golf courses in inner Canberra suburbs are becoming attractive sites for redevelopment to provide much-needed housing and a way for struggling clubs to bolster their budgets.

item.title: Sculpture by the Sea could be cancelled due to $200,000 shortfall
item.description: Australia's famed sculpture walk is facing cancellation after failing to secure funding less than a month out from this year's event.

item.title: Man behind iconic ABC TV programs, Graham White, dies aged 93
item.description: Graham White was a pioneer of Australian radio and television and played a key role in the creation of numerous television series, including A Big Country.

item.title: Despite past controversy, NSW Police commissioner Mal Lanyon has a strong backing
item.description: For newly-announced Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon, Wednesday morning would have been both one of his proudest moments, and his most uncomfortable.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel returns, addressing Charlie Kirk and 'un-American' axing
item.description: Despite the late-night host's return, several US ABC affiliates did not air the episode, excluding an estimated one-quarter of American households.

item.title: Rape case against Bruce Lehrmann delayed after lawyer misses deadline
item.description: A judge says the process of a bid to stop a criminal rape case against former Liberal Party staffer Bruce Lehrmann proceeding has been "problematic" after his lawyer missed a key deadline.

item.title: Doctor who lost daughter to brain cancer receives grant in race to clinical trials
item.description: A professor who lost his daughter to brain cancer in 2018 is hopeful the research to find a cure in children is just five years away from clinical trials.

item.title: Optus to pay $100m fine, as crisis engulfing Australia's second biggest telco continues
item.description: In enforcing the fine today, the Federal Court's Justice Patrick O'Sullivan described the company's conduct as "extremely serious" and "appalling".

item.title: Concerns Launceston City Council could give away Birchalls CBD site it bought for $8.8m
item.description: Launceston City Council bought the historic Birchalls building for $8.8 million five years ago. A ratepayer association says it has learnt of a proposal to give it away "for nothing".

item.title: Missouri woman gets more than four years jail for trying to sell off Elvis' Graceland property
item.description: A woman's attempt to sell off one of the most storied pieces of real estate in the US has come to naught. Here's how it happened.

item.title: Electric vehicle-to-grid trial in Exmouth generates promising results for state power distributor
item.description: State distributor Horizon Power says a trial of bi-directional charging with electric vehicles to both supplement the grid and take up excess power, known as V2G, has proved a success.

item.title: Former A-League footballers Clayton Lewis and Kearyn Baccus sentenced over betting scam
item.description: Both players were paid $10,000 each to intentionally get themselves yellow cards while playing for Macarthur FC against Sydney FC to influence overseas bets on the game.

item.title: Farmer Sam Bailey, who worked to be the world's first quadriplegic helicopter pilot, dies
item.description: A "true blue" farmer, pilot, and pioneer for accessibility in agriculture has been honoured after his sudden death.

item.title: Thousands of Australians fighting 'cruel' battle for COVID vaccine injury compensation
item.description: Thousands of Australians who were injured by COVID vaccines say they are facing a 'cruel and complex' system to get compensation from the government.

item.title: Former police officer Stephen Michael Calcutt pleads guilty to filming teenagers in shower and up skirt
item.description: The former sergeant also filmed up another teenager's skirt and had a number of cartoons depicting children in sexual situations on a hard drive.

item.title: Senate inquiry examines federal environment department's SA algal bloom response
item.description: Officials from the federal environment department say they were not aware of the impact of SA's algal bloom until the state government contacted them in May, two months after the bloom was first detected. Speaking at a senate inquiry, department officials say the federal environment minister was not formally briefed on the bloom until July.

item.title: Alzheimer's drug Lecanemab approved by Therapeutic Goods Administration for use in Australia
item.description: The Therapeutic Goods Administration approves the drug Lecanemab, which can slow down cognitive decline in the early stages of Alzheimer's.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa hits south China as death toll rises to 14
item.description: Super Typhoon Ragasa has killed at least 14 people in Taiwan as it struck the southern Chinese coast.

item.title: One dead in 'targeted' shooting at Dallas immigration centre, DHS says
item.description: Police were first alerted to the incident at 6:40am on Wednesday, local time, and later found the shooter on a nearby roof dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

item.title: London mayor calls Trump racist, sexist and Islamophobic, hitting back at US president's 'sharia law' comments
item.description: The US president described Sadiq Khan as "terrible" and warned the British capital was heading towards "sharia law".

item.title: Kimmel monologue racks up millions of views on social media as Joe Rogan slams government 'dictating'
item.description: Kimmel's program was indefinitely suspended last week after he made comments about the late conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Australia's social media ban wins praise from Europe at UN event
item.description: Australia's willingness to take on the social media giants is drawing significant international interest, winning the support of the European Commission president at a forum in New York.

item.title: Australia in a 'dangerous place' as AI adoption ramps up, prompting calls to protect jobs
item.description: Artificial intelligence is coming for our jobs — but will it take them away, or just give us a powerful new assistant?

item.title: Who is really pulling the strings at Optus and what does that mean for you?
item.description: The Singapore government's sovereign wealth investment vehicle is the majority owner of Singtel, which owns Australia's second-largest telco provider.

item.title: Andrew Hastie taunted over claim that high immigration is making Australians 'strangers in our own home'
item.description: The home affairs minister says Andrew Hastie should name which visa classes he would cut after the shadow home affairs minister suggested "unsustainable" immigration was making Australians "feel like strangers in our own home".

item.title: Hastie downplays 'mischievous' leadership speculation – as it happened
item.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Hastie brushes off suggestions he is a threat to Sussan Ley's leadership after a series of outspoken social media posts.

item.title: Will food prices ever come down? Don't bet on it
item.description: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

item.title: Zelenskyy blames Putin for 'most destructive arms race in human history'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Free speech pathologist sessions turning poor literacy rates around in Logan
item.description: A federal government backed weekly reading session led by experts is helping improve literacy rates in Queensland children.

item.title: Independent review launched into fire ant eradication program amid 'closing window of opportunity'
item.description: Authorities launch an independent review of Australia's national fire ant eradication program to evaluate the country's fight against one of the world’s most destructive pests.

item.title: Families demand inquiry into NSW Police handling of missing persons cases
item.description: Nikii Smith is one of 10,000 people who signed a petition calling for a NSW inquiry into the handling of missing persons cases.

item.title: China retains narrow edge over US as South-East Asia's most influential partner
item.description: New research shows that China retains a very narrow edge over the United States as South-East Asia's most influential partner, with experts predicting it will soon pull further ahead as the Trump administration's policies begin to bite.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa leaves trail of destruction in Hong Kong, mainland China
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Family calls for change amid frustration at seven-year coronial inquest wait
item.description: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

item.title: Elevated E. coli levels recorded at major NT crocodile farm owned by luxury label Hermès
item.description: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

item.title: Indigenous teen speaks out against heckling of Welcome to Country
item.description: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

item.title: New gene therapy for Huntington's 'changes everything', say researchers
item.description: Clinical trials of a groundbreaking new gene therapy for Huntington's disease have shown that it slows progression of the condition by 75 per cent after three years, researchers say.

item.title: Alexa Leary and Callum Simpson win gold medals for Australia at World Para Swimming Championships in Singapore
item.description: Alexa Leary's win in the final individual event of Wednesday night's action in Singapore bookended a golden night for Australia after Callum Simpson won gold in the first event of the evening.

item.title: 'On guard' for share market correction, Optus debacle began in India — as it happened
item.description: Optus has now told the ABC the firewall upgrade that led to disrupted triple-0 calls was initiated in Chennai, India. Meanwhile veteran stockbroker Marcus Padley says he's "on guard" for a share market wipe-out.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns UN of 'the most destructive arms race in human history'
item.description: Ukraine's president calls for global action to regulate the twin threats posed by drone technology and artificial intelligence, warning "no-one can feel safe" from Russia's expansionist goals.

item.title: AFL grand final sprint won't feature all teams, as Gout Gout and Harry Garside to feature at the MCG
item.description: The AFL announces that only seven AFL players will run in the traditional grand final sprint, with Olympic boxer Harry Garside also joining in.

item.title: Macquarie to repay Shield investors after super platform failures
item.description: Macquarie commits to repaying thousands of Australians who invested hundreds of millions of their retirement savings in the collapsed Shield Master Fund amid admissions it contravened the Corporations Act.

item.title: China's President Xi Jinping announces new climate goal to cut emissions by 2035
item.description: Outlining China's new carbon targets in a video link to the UN climate conference in New York, President Xi Jinping says "green and low carbon transition is the trend of our time".

item.title: Dramatic footage shows sinkhole swallowing up road in central Bangkok
item.description: Social media footage shows powerlines being pulled down into the 50-metre deep hole and vehicles teetering on the edge.

item.title: Growing AFL fan club for people with disability helps forge friendships
item.description: A growing club on the border between Victoria and New South Wales helps AFL fans with disabilities connect with friends who share their love for the sport.

item.title: Andrea James to lead Ilbijerri Theatre Company as artistic director Rachael Maza steps back
item.description: Andrea James will take the helm of Australia's oldest Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri, as outgoing artistic director Rachael Maza steps back after almost 18 years.

item.title: Man charged with multiple offences over pursuit, police say
item.description: South Australia Police says a Vale Park man has been charged following a pursuit that led STAR group officers and police negotiators to a unit in Adelaide's western suburbs.

item.title: NT para athlete Briseis Brittain wasn't born when Cathy Freeman won Olympic gold, but the moment fired a dream
item.description: Arnhem Land teenager Briseis Brittain is set to represent Australia at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi this month, competing in the 200m and 400m races.

item.title: Anthony Albanese addresses UN on climate goals, Gaza and Australia's security council bid
item.description: The prime minister uses his UN speech to talk up Australia's emissions plan after Donald Trump called climate change a "con job", and confirms Australia is still seeking a temporary seat on the body's security council.

item.title: New head of Queensland's troubled DNA lab says backlog of testing could take years to clear
item.description: More than 170 rape kits caught up in the Forensic Science Queensland laboratory's backlog will be sent offshore next week for vital forensic testing, as the facility's new boss says it will take years to clear them.

item.title: Figure skating star scraps program amid probe involving artist who co-wrote music
item.description: Figure skaters spend months perfecting their programs ahead of big competitions, but now world champion Alysa Liu has to come up with a new short program months out from the Winter Olympics as her existing music involves an American artist under investigation.

item.title: Scott Selwood takes break from AFL after 'personally challenging year'
item.description: Scott Selwood will take time away from football, stepping down as an assistant coach with Collingwood, following a year marked by personal tragedy.

item.title: AI image recognition technology used to detect traffic offences raises privacy concerns, Queensland audit finds
item.description: Queensland's transport department uses AI in its cameras to detect mobile and seatbelt offences, but a new audit has ordered called for a review into how that's done.

item.title: Breastfeeding in public is protected in Australia. So why are mothers still facing discrimination?
item.description: Last week a breastfeeding mother was asked to leave a Virgin Australia lounge for pumping. Experts says while there is a level of awareness that breastfeeding in public is protected, some people in the community still view it as "inappropriate".

item.title: What are Australia's chances of returning to the UN Security Council?
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes a fresh push for Australia to get a seat on the United Nations Security Council in 2029-30.

item.title: Snoop Dogg says AFL grand final is 'a way of life' ahead of headline show
item.description: Snoop Dogg has strutted into the MCG for his official appearance ahead of a fascinating, somewhat controversial, AFL grand-final entertainment set.

item.title: Planned sale of RAC WA's insurance arm to IAG sparks member disquiet amid jump in profit
item.description: The head of Western Australia's biggest insurer says having a Sydney-based owner is the "best path forward" for its customers, but some are threatening to leave if the acquisition goes ahead.

item.title: Denmark PM apologises to indigenous Greenlanders who faced forced contraception
item.description: The apology by Mette Frederiksen in Greenland’s capital, Nuuk, hopes to close a traumatic chapter in Greenland's history.

item.title: Gisborne football netball club members hit back with legal threat after AFL rejects league switch
item.description: The Victorian club wants to move into a different league because several clubs in the Ballarat league, including Darley, Sunbury and Melton, are much closer to Gisborne.

item.title: Violent man abandons appeal to avoid jail for assaulting teenage ex-girlfriend
item.description: A 19-year-old Victorian man, who recorded 67 prior convictions for stalking and breaching family violence orders against his young ex-girlfriend, has failed in a bid to stay out of jail.

item.title: Tasmanian government seeks to claw back $56k legal bill from former LGH boss Peter Renshaw
item.description: A review has found three Tasmanian public servants did not act in good faith during the state's child abuse commission of inquiry and recommends clawing back up to $76,000 in legal fees.

item.title: Trio of space weather satellites launched to study the Sun's violent side
item.description: NASA successfully launches multiple satellites designed to get a better understanding of the Sun's influence on Earth.

item.title: TGA approves new brain stimulation device for treatment of depression
item.description: Some international users of Flow Neuroscience's device have labelled the wearable tech as a game-changer in treating depression, but not everyone is convinced.

item.title: Wallabies vs All Blacks Bledisloe Cup: Team lists, what time is kick-off? How can I watch?
item.description: Wallabies prop James Slipper will notch an important milestone against New Zealand on Saturday, while James O'Connor will start at fly half.

item.title: South Australia passes laws to protect victims of personal injury from 'claim farmers'
item.description: Individuals who contact a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation could face fines of up to $50,000 under new laws which have passed in South Australia.

item.title: Hastie lets loose, one-on-one with Albanese and Trump, and the politics of Palestinian recognition
item.description: It turns out that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese didn't need a can of Diet Coke and a cheeseburger to attracted the US president's attention.

item.title: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright set to appeal guilty verdict on five grounds
item.description: Matt Wright’s lawyers have confirmed they will file a notice of appeal within the next 48 hours, indicating it will be based on five different grounds.

item.title: Ahead of the biggest game of his NRL career, Nicho Hynes returns to where it all began
item.description: Ten years to the day since his first moment in the spotlight, Nicho Hynes returns to AAMI Park for the most important game of his NRL career.

item.title: SA government grapples with whether it should issue daily bloom updates during summer
item.description: South Australia's Premier says the government is grappling with whether it should give daily updates on the bloom's location during summer, and says it has been "actively engaged" in conversations with the federal government since its emergence.

item.title: Liberal veteran Amanda Vanstone chides Andrew Hastie for not being a team player, warns of runaway ego
item.description: A doyenne of the Liberal Party and veteran of leadership battles dating back to the 1980s Howard-Peacock era has chided Andrew Hastie for not being a team player.

item.title: Matildas strike force could benefit from having both Sam Kerr and Michelle Heyman firing fit up front
item.description: A fit-again Sam Kerr doesn't necessarily spell the end for Michelle Heyman's time in the Matildas, if anything the A-League star can't wait for her return.

item.title: SA Water fined $60k for causing 'environmental harm' during botched maintenance of Warren Reservoir
item.description: SA Water — which is owned by the SA government — has been fined for polluting the waterways with grey clay silt when draining the Warren Reservoir, in the Barossa Valley, in May 2023.

item.title: Albury Wodonga Health surgeon claims he was sacked for criticising development plans
item.description: An Albury Wodonga surgeon says the local health service dismissed him after he spoke out against a major redevelopment of the hospital and changes to the region's cancer centre.

item.title: Measles case detected in Brisbane, prompting calls for vaccination
item.description: Queensland's health department says the person was believed to have contracted the virus in Bali, before visiting a number of businesses across Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast.

item.title: Lawyers for Raiders star Josh Papalii ask court to permanently stay charges over police group chat
item.description: The Raiders star's lawyers are asking the ACT Magistrates Court to permanently stay charges against him over a 2024 incident.

item.title: University of Wollongong ordered to repay more than $6 million in underpayments
item.description: Investigations have found 5,340 current and former University of Wollongong employees between 2014 and 2024 have been underpaid wages and superannuation amounting to $6.6 million.

item.title: Horse trainer Dwayne Schmidt jailed for raping and impregnating 13yo girl
item.description: New South Wales horse trainer Dwayne Schmidt is sentenced to more than three years in jail for raping and impregnating a 13-year-old girl.

item.title: Gympie Regional Council votes to remove fluoride from town's water supply
item.description: Gympie scraps fluoride from its water supply and becomes the third region in Queensland to reject the practice in just over a year.

item.title: Coroner finds Monash Health provided unreasonable care before toddler Dio Kemp's death
item.description: Three-year-old Dio Kemp was taken to Monash Medical Centre four times over 10 days before she died of sepsis.

item.title: Huge red-bell jellyfish bloom and mass puffer fish deaths put Pilbara coast on alert
item.description: Hundreds of dead puffer fish are found on a Pilbara beach, as an epic red-bell jellyfish bloom prompts a warning from the region's ports authority.

item.title: Arts industry leaders call for tax reforms to help struggling sector
item.description: Arts industry leaders say creative tax form is needed to create greater opportunities for Australian artists.
